I just finished reading "Generating Large-Scale Neural Networks
Through Dis=
covering Geometric Regularities" and I had a couple of
quick questions.

1)=
 The paper says that in the HyperNEAT experiments, there was a 3%
chance of=
 adding a hidden node.  How exactly does this work? Doesn't
the CPPN need t=
o know of a hidden layer at the start?  It looks to me
like there is only a=
n input/source layer and an output/target layer
that's being mapped in the =
state-space sandwich.

2) Why were tests run against P-NEAT and not against=
 regular NEAT? Was
it just for saving computational resources?


I loved th=
e paper though overall.  It's really exciting and hopefully
I'll be able to=
 use it in a project I'm planning on starting.

Thanks,
Wesley
